sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The picture of Mercurius Politicus: or Some of his falsities and mistakes, mentioned in his intelligence of the twelfth of October, concerning the dispute in Lumbardstreet, detected and disproved. Wherein the carriage of the people resort-in to the meeting-place there, upon the said day, and other times, is cleared: to the satisfaction of those that will not censure before they understand, nor give up their judgments to trust vanity and lyes. By John Webster. Webster, John, 1610-1682.
8 p.
printed for T. Webster and R. Hammond., London, : [1653]
Dated at end: Octob. 25. 1653. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octob: 27 1653". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Wherein the carriage of the people resort-in to the meeting-place there, upon the said day, and other times, is cleared: to the satisfaction of those that will not censure before they understand, nor give up their judgments to trust vanity and lyes. By John Webster. Webster, John, 1610-1682.
8 p.
printed for T. Webster and R. Hammond., London, : [1653]
Dated at end: Octob. 25. 1653. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octob: 27 1653". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
